concept_data.title: United Nations International Drug Control Programme

summary: The "UN International Drug Control Programme" is a pivotal initiative under the auspices of the United Nations, aimed at addressing global drug-related issues through comprehensive regulatory frameworks. This programme is integral to the EU's legal and regulatory landscape, as it informs the development of policies that combat drug trafficking and abuse within member states. By aligning with the UN's objectives, the EU enhances its commitment to international cooperation in drug control. The concept serves as a redirect to the preferred term, emphasizing its significance in EU documents that address international obligations and collaborative efforts in drug policy formulation and enforcement.
